reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights in July. It's an 8-10 walk from the train station; in some cities, that might mean you were in a sketchy part of town, but not so in Luzern, since the train station is central to almost everything. Our neighborhood was upscale and interesting, again just 8-10 walk to the river and the old town. The hotel was relatively modern, certainly chic in the lobby; the room was large and comfortable, ditto the bathroom. As usual, everything was spotlessly clean. Staff was friendly and helpful; breakfast buffet the best of our trip (omelets cooked to order). We ate only breakfast in the hotel restaurant. Luzern is wonderful, and the hotel helped make it possible. Tip: it's much easier to walk from the train station, pulling a suitcase, to the Cascada than going into the old town, over cobblestones. Also: elevators and airconditioning.
reviews.title: Fine hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Cascada for two weeks on our annual summer holiday. It is a good hotel with nice staff but a bit lacking in some areas for a 4-star hotel.
reviews.title: Good hotel with friendly staff

reviews.text: The waterfall theme extends to the rooms which have mural paintings of Swiss waterfalls. Our room was a bit small (they all are apparently) and sparsely furnished. The wardrobe was just a few shelves and hangers attached to the wall. However there was a big television and good radio, both with several international stations. There was a good supply of toiletries in the bathroom. We had a balcony too. Although we were at the front of the hotel, which was on a busy road, there was good insulation so no traffic noise at night.
reviews.title: Wowhh!!!!!

reviews.text: The Spanish restaurant Bolero is excellent - the food is always of a high standard and lots of the locals seem to eat there. There is a small bar which is really an extension of the restaurant - service very good but the furniture had seen better days. The hotel also mentions a "lounge" but this does not exist - it is just a bar! The public areas could be better for a hotel of this class.
reviews.title: Big rooms! Free Wlan!

reviews.text: The Cascada is a comfortable hotel in a convenient location.
reviews.title: Nice cosy hotel for family

reviews.text: This hotel offers an exceptionally good value for the price in one of the most beautiful--and most visited--cities in Europe. The location is a pleasant walking distance (10 min.) from the main cultural attractions yet removed from the ongoing street noise--very important during the summertime/festival season. The entire property is immaculate, the rooms are a decent size and well appointed, the breakfast offerings were fresh and of good variety.
reviews.title: Great value, smart location, immaculate rooms, professional staff

reviews.text: I felt that this hotel was a great find. As someone particularly sensitive to noise and cleanliness, I was very happy with my stay.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: Me and my family stayed there for 3 nights and it was good. The room we had was big and had a good T.V. The location was great is was close to the train station and not far away from a nice lake. The food isnt that bad but it finishes quickly.The staff where helpfull and nice. The good thing is that there are a few fast food restaurant around such as Mcdonalds and burger king since the hotels restaurant is pretty expensive.
